Package chess

Class Clocks

java.lang.Object
chess.Clocks
public class Clocks
extends java.lang.Object
This class controls the clocks for both players.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Seth Steinbrook and Getty Muthiani

  • Constructor Summary

    Clocks constructor.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void resetClocks()
    Stops both clocks and resets them.

    Set both clocks to 10 minutes with no increment.

    Set the increment for player one.

  • Method Details

    • updatePlayerClocks

      public void updatePlayerClocks()
      Called at the end of a player's turn. Stops the clock of the player whose turn just ended and starts the clock for their opponent. Also updates the clock labels.

    • resetClocks

      public void resetClocks()
      Stops both clocks and resets them.

    • setTimePlayerOne

      public void setTimePlayerOne​(int min, int sec)
      Set the time control for player one.
      Parameters:
      min - int minutes to start with
      sec - int seconds to start with

    • setTimePlayerTwo

      public void setTimePlayerTwo​(int min, int sec)
      Set the time control for player two.
      Parameters:
      min - int minutes to start with
      sec - int seconds to start with

    • setIncrementPlayerOne

      public void setIncrementPlayerOne​(int inc)
      Set the increment for player one.
      Parameters:
      inc - int increment in seconds

    • setIncrementPlayerTwo

      public void setIncrementPlayerTwo​(int inc)
      Set the increment for player two.
      Parameters:
      inc - int increment in seconds

    • setDefaultTimes

      public void setDefaultTimes()
      Set both clocks to 10 minutes with no increment.
